abstract: Family of Kathleen McCormack Durst, woman who disappeared in 1982 from Mineola, NY, home, files $100 million lawsuit against her husband Robert A Durst, under rarely used New York State law granting immediate members of family right to possession of body for burial; suit also contends that Durst murdered Kathleen, his first wife.
lead_paragraph: The mother and three sisters of Kathleen Durst, who disappeared decades ago, are employing a rarely cited law to pursue the man they have long suspected of killing her, the wealthy scion of a New York City real estate family.

headline.main: Family of Robert Durst’s First Wife Sues Him for $100 Million in Her Disappearance
headline.print_headline: Former In-Laws Sue Durst for $100 Million Over First Wife’s Vanishing
